points.threat_name: Critical Vulnerabilities in Cisco Contact Center Appliance
points.title: Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerabilities in Contact Center Appliance
points.summary: Cisco has patched critical vulnerabilities in its Contact Center Appliance that allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely and escalate privileges to root on affected systems. These flaws pose a severe risk as they enable full system compromise if exploited. The vulnerabilities were disclosed on November 6, 2025, highlighting the urgent need for affected organizations to apply patches promptly to mitigate potential attacks.
relevance_reasons: Impacts Customer Care CRM Platform
CRM platform is internet facing
CRM platform has high data sensitivity
Risk appetite is low

points.title: Critical vulnerabilities in eUICC chips used in eSIMs
points.summary: Vulnerabilities in eUICC chips used in eSIMs could allow attackers to clone eSIM profiles, intercept communications, install backdoors, and brick devices. Exploitation of Java Card flaws enables bypassing isolation and accessing secure memory. Mitigation includes bytecode verification, security audits, and stricter GSMA compliance.
relevance_reasons: Impacts 4G/5G Core Network Platform which is a crown jewel and has high data sensitivity.
Impacts Enterprise SD-WAN & MPLS Orchestrator.

points.threat_name: Microsoft and Adobe October 2025 Patch Tuesday Vulnerabilities
points.title: Microsoft and Adobe October 2025 Patch Tuesday Vulnerabilities
points.source: Microsoft Patch Tuesday October 2025 Security Update Review
points.summary: Microsoft and Adobe Patch Tuesday, October 2025 Security Update Review. Addresses 193 vulnerabilities including 9 critical and 6 zero-day. Includes patches for Windows, Microsoft Edge, Adobe products, AMD EPYC processors, IGEL OS. Key vulnerabilities include CVE-2025-24990 and CVE-2025-24052 (Windows Agere Modem Driver elevation of privilege), CVE-2025-59230 (Windows Remote Access Connection Manager elevation of privilege), CVE-2025-2884 (TCG TPM2.0 out-of-bounds read), CVE-2025-47827 (Secure Boot bypass in IGEL OS), and CVE-2025-0033 (AMD EPYC RMP corruption). Qualys VMDR supports detection and remediation.
relevance_reasons: Impacts Corporate Email & Collaboration (M365)
Impacts Customer Care CRM Platform
Impacts Customer Identity & Access Platform
Microsoft and Adobe products are used

points.title: University of Pennsylvania Cybersecurity Incident
points.summary: The University of Pennsylvania confirmed a cybersecurity incident involving unauthorized access to internal systems. The threat actor stole data on approximately 4.2 million donors, students, and alumni. The attack occurred between October 30 and October 31, 2025, through a compromised PennKey SSO account.
relevance_reasons: No assets in the customer profile matched the affected products or vendors mentioned in the threat.

points.title: Ernst & Young (EY) Data Breach Due to Cloud Misconfiguration
points.summary: Ernst & Young (EY) experienced a data breach due to cloud misconfiguration on Microsoft Azure, exposing 478 GB of data. Impacted data included user data, API keys, credentials, authentication tokens, and database schemas. Mitigation involves implementing proper access controls and monitoring.
relevance_reasons: Cloud misconfiguration can lead to data exposure in Airtel's cloud environments.

points.title: Qilin ransomware escalates rapidly in 2025, targeting critical sectors with 700 attacks amid RansomHub shutdown
points.summary: Qilin ransomware has rapidly escalated attacks in 2025, targeting critical sectors including manufacturing, healthcare, and government. The group uses a ransomware-as-a-service model and has been linked to breaches of over 2.3 million records and the theft of 116 terabytes of data. Notable attacks include those on Asahi Group Holdings, Shamir Medical Center, and various government agencies.
relevance_reasons: Impacts critical infrastructure (4G/5G Core Network Platform)
